quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Proof and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, magazine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which magazine stated,  We are sorry to announce that Mr. Albert Brown has been quite unwell, owing to his recent death, and is taking a short holiday to recover.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parish

questions.question: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. graduated with a degree in Sociology from what college?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morehouse College

questions.question: This former member of the pop punk band Blink 182 was quoted as saying that he had never been to Kenya because Thats not a place where Im considered good-looking.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Hoppus

questions.question: Martin Luther King, Jr. was president of this civil right organization which he led until his assassination.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southern Christian Leadership Organization

questions.question: What brilliant actress said, If youre killed youve lost a very important part of your life.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooke Shields

questions.question: The March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom, a large political rally at which Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. delivered his famous I have a Dream speech, took place on what date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August 28, 1963

questions.question: What former Vice President of the United States said the following, We understand the importance of having bondage between the parents and their children.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Quayle

questions.question: What pro-golfer said, I owe a lot to my parents, especially my mother and father.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greg Norman

questions.question: Which late President of the United States said the following, The world is more like it is now then it ever has before.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight  D. Eisenhower

questions.question: What famous football player stated, The word genius isnt applicable in football. A genius is a guy like Norman Einstein.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Theisman

questions.question: Which President of the United States said the following, You can teach a child to read, and he or her will be able to pass a literacy test.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bush

questions.question: Which politician said these words, I think gay marriage should be between a man and a woman.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Schwarzenegger

questions.question: What Prime Minister was quoted as saying A proof is a proof. What kind of proof? Its a proof. And when you have a good proof, its because it is proven.?

options.text: Australian Prime Minister John Winston Howard

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien

questions.question: In what year was Dr.  Martin Luther King, Jr. awarded the Nobel Peace Prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1964

questions.question: Billy the Kid killed 21 men in his lifetime.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Office and Martin Luther King
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, jail, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This president was born in Albemarle County, Virginia on April 13, 1743. He was is office 1801 - 1809. He died on July 4, 1826.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Is it true that on October 1909, President William H. Taft became the first President to walk into the Oval Office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Martin Luther King, Jr. was awarded a PhD degree by which university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston University

questions.question: Which U.S. President made the first transcontinental phone call from the Oval Office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodrow Wilson

questions.question: Which of the following is the name of the Memphis motel in which Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. was assassinated on April 4, 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorraine Motel

questions.question: This U.S. President was in office from 1797 - 1801. He died on July 4, 1826.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: This president was in office from 1789 - 1797. He was born in Westmoreland County, Virginia on February 22, 1732 and died of a throat infection on December 14, 1799.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: In which year did Time Magazine name Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Man of the Year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: Dwight D. Eisenhower was in office 1945 - 1953.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This U.S. President is considered to be the Father of the Constitution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: When was U.S. president James Buchanan in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1857 - 1861

questions.question: Letter from Birmingham Jail, an open letter by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., was first published in which of the following political magazines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New Leader

questions.question: Who stabbed Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. in the chest while he was autographing his recently published book in Harlem, New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Izola Curry

questions.question: At what age was Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. ordained a minister at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19

questions.question: Which of the following is a first ladys correct name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Virginia Wallace Truman

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: President and Senator
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, leader, bomber. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the leader of the Continental Army in the American Revolutionary War, who became the first President of United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: On a mission over the Pacific as a torpedo bomber pilot this future US President was shot down by Japanese antiaircraft fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George H.W. Bush

questions.question: Senator and Vice President Hubert Humphrey died in 1978 after a heroic battle with cancer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was President of the US, when American astronauts landed on the moon in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Nixon

questions.question: This senator from the state of Washington was nicknamed Scoop and ran unsuccessfully for President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Jackson

questions.question: This US President was shot by a would-be assassin only 69 days after he assumed office.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: As a young boy this senator from Hawaii helped the fallen during and after the attack on Pearl Harbor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Inouye

questions.question: Who defeated John Adams for reelection and became the third President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which President delivered the famous words, Ask not what your country can do for you--ask what you can do for your country.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: On June 12, 2006, this senator broke the record for the longest serving senator when he left office at age 100.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strom Thurmond

questions.question: What US President declared the freedom of the slaves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: Who assumed the Presidency in 1933, at the depth of the Great Depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: Who is the first president to have won a Pulitzer Prize?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: Before becoming the 34th US President, he served as Supreme Commander of the Allied forces in Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight D. Eisenhower

questions.question: Which of the following was invented by Samuel Leeds Allen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flexible Flyer

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Explorer and Invention
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cape, discovery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first English explorer to sail around the world and return alive in England in 1580?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Drake

questions.question: Which name does not belong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Lee Chambers

questions.question: What is the name of the first astronaut to walk on the surface of the moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: This was the great invention of Edwin Howard Armstrong.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FM radio

questions.question: What was B. B. Molloys invention?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prozac

questions.question: What Portuguese explorer was the first to reach the Cape of Good Hope by sailing from Portugal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bartolomeu Dias

questions.question: Harry Coover was trying to develop a gunsight lens when he invented this.

options.text: the variable focal length eye glass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Superglue

questions.question: What Scottish missionary and explorer of central Africa was the first European to see the Victoria Falls and name them in honor of Queen Victoria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Livingstone

questions.question: What Genoese explorer sailed off Spain on 3 August 1492 across the Atlantic Ocean and discovered the Americas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: Which of these men was responsible for the invention of fiberglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: R. Games Slayter

questions.question: Which of the following was invented by a banjo player working at a company that made sandpaper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adhesive tape

questions.question: This was Stephanie Kwoleks big discovery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevlar

questions.question: This British captain explored the Pacific Ocean and was the first to reach New Zealand, Australia and Hawaii.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Cook

questions.question: This Venetian explorer, who lived in the 13th-14th century, traveled across Asia and wrote an account of his travels known as Il Milione.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marco Polo

questions.question: What did Roy J. Plunkett invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teflon

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Malcolm and Malcolm X
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, college, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: First Lady Mamie Eisenhower liked watching soap operas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Most of U.S. First Ladies belonged to which of the following religious denominations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Episcopalian

questions.question: Prompted by this person, Malcolm X converted to Islam.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his brother

questions.question: First Lady Margaret Taylor reportedly prayed nightly for her husbands defeat in elections.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which First Lady was in China during the 1900 Boxer Rebellion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Hoover

questions.question: What happened to Malcolm X in 1965?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was shot.

questions.question: Malcolm X was a college graduate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the first explorer to reach the South Pole, and also the first person to reach both the North and South Poles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: Name the First Lady who shared a name with one of the Muppets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Roosevelt

questions.question: How many siblings did Malcolm X have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10

questions.question: Who did Malcolm X marry in 1958?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Betty Shabazz

questions.question: This Portuguese explorer became the first European to successfully reach India from Europe around the Cape of Good Hope.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vasco da Gama

questions.question: Malcolm Xs father, Earl Little, was a Baptist minister.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the Spanish explorer who conquered the Inca Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francisco Pizarro

questions.question: Name the First Lady who worked as a nurses aide in 1943?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nancy Reagan

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Al Capone and England
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, al. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Queen Elizabeth I of England is also known under this nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which wife of King Henry VIII of England was the mother of Queen Elizabeth I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Boleyn

questions.question: Al Capone led a crime syndicate during the Prohibition Era.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the real first name of Al Capone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alphonse

questions.question: What happened on Saint Valentines Day in 1929?

options.text: Al Capone was convicted by federal government.
Al Capone arranged a gangland killing.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Capone arranged a gangland killing.

questions.question: What was Al Capones nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarface

questions.question: What year was Al Capone convicted by the US federal government for income-tax evasion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1931

questions.question: Where was American gangster Al Capone born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyn, New York, U.S

questions.question: The North Side gang shot into Al Capones entourage while he was having lunch at this place?

options.text: The restaurant of “Warwick New York Hotel”

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The restaurant of  “Hawthorne Hotel”

questions.question: Al Capone resumed his criminal activities after completing his term in Alcatraz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Al Capone was the boss of a criminal organization known as the Detroit Outfit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Al Capone had a son known as Sonny.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name the First Lady who reportedly allowed her cows to graze on the White House lawn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eliza McCaudle Johnson

questions.question: Eleanor Roosevelt, First Lady from 1933 to 1945, once served hot dogs to the King and Queen of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name the  First Lady who  reportedly crocheted 3500 pairs of slippers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ida Saxton McKinley
